decu package¶

Module contents¶

Decu is a library for experimental computation scripts.

Submodules¶

Script.py¶

Main decu classes and decorators.

class decu.Script.Script(working_dir, file_name)[source]¶

Bases: object

Base class for experimental computation scripts.

decu.Script.experiment(data_param=None)[source]¶

Decorator that adds logging functionality to experiment methods.

Parameters:data_param (str) – Parameter treated by the method as data

input. All other parameters are treated as experimental parameters.

Returns:A decorator that adds bookkeeping functionality to its argument.
Return type:func
decu.Script.figure(show=False, save=True)[source]¶

Create the figure decorator.

Parameters:
  • show (bool) – Whether or not the figure should be shown.
  • save (bool) – Whether or not the figure should be saved to disk.
Returns:

A decorator that adds figure logging functionality to its argument.
Return type:

func
decu.Script.run_parallel(exp, params)[source]¶

Run an experiment in parallel.

For each element p in params, call exp(*p). These calls are made in parallel using multiprocessing.

Parameters:
  • exp (method) – A @experiment-decorated method.
  • params (list) – Each element is a set of arguments to call exp with.
Returns:

A dictionary where the key pi is an element of params and the value is the result of calling exp(*pi).
Return type:

dict
decu.Script.read_result(infile)[source]¶

Read result from disk.

Chose reading method according to result’s type.
